title: [Self-directed] Inquiry- and Task-Based Simulation Learning Design for Molecular Kinetic Theory and the Ideal Gas Law

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic chemistry concepts (atoms, molecules, gaseous states) and ability to use simple laboratory tools
context.additional_context: Classroom environment enabling simulation activities using digital devices (tablets/PCs)

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of kinetic molecular theory (pressure-volume-temperature relationships) through experiments
Learners can interpret mathematical models of the ideal gas law (PV=nRT) by connecting them to actual simulation data
Learners can establish learning strategies appropriate to their cognitive level when selecting inquiry-based/activity-based simulations
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
